For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Court Order] 1790 Mar. 16, [to] Benjamin Lewis / Samuel Preser
bibl.author: Preser, Samuel
bibl.note: This document is a order issued by the Superior court of Washington District to Benjamin Lewis. It notifies him to appear at his neighbor's house in order to cross-examine several men in a court matter.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: Notice. Mr. Benjamin Lewis you are hereby notified to attend at the house of your near neighbor, John Davies, on Monday the 29th instant at 11: o'clock then and there to crossexamine James Harris, Jonathan Harris, Reese Price, John Davies, Samuel Davies, James Meek, Esqre. Joseph Ross and Joseph Teaser who is summoned then and there to give evidence in a matter of controversey in the Superior court pope of Washington District depending wherein Hezekiah Balch is plaintiff and P. Benjamin Lewis is Defendant. Given under our hands (in behalf of sd. Hezekiah Balch) this 16th day of March 1790.

closer.add:
Mecklenburg County. Samuel Leaper deposeth that he was present and saw George Elliot Constable deliver to Benjamin Lewis's wife in her dwelling house on Thursday the 10th instant a notice word for word with the inclosed and George Elliott deposeth that he delivered her the said notice and in the evening of sd day he saw P. Benjamin going home and told him he had left sd notice with his wife at sd time shewed him the summonses for the sd men to meet the 29th instant. Sworn & signed to this 26th March 1790 before J. McAlexander.
Saml Preser Geo Elliott notice to Mr. Benjamin Lewis
